25-02-06-communication1.title: Automated data clean-up in the Time and Labour module
25-02-06-communication1.whatYouNeedToKnow:
• Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) will be performing a data clean-up activity in the pay system’s Time and Labour module that will change the status of outstanding un-actionable pay transactions to “closed”.
  • As of February 8, 2025, users will be able to view which transactions were closed as a result of this activity and the reason (see Resources below).
  • Following the clean-up activity, future un-actionable pay transactions in the Time and Labour module will be automatically closed by the pay system on a bi-weekly basis.
25-02-06-communication1.actionRequired: No action is required as this process is automated.
25-02-06-communication1.notes: Departments will continue to receive the bi-weekly Time and Labour reports (R317 and R318) listing transactions that require approval or review to support Section 34 managers. However, you may see a reduction in the number of transactions listed as a result of the clean-up activity and automation.
25-02-06-communication1.resources: The Time and Labour Payable Status Reason Codes for Closed Transactions job aid describes the ‘Closed’ Payable Time status and the different reason codes to identify why a transaction was changed to a ‘Closed’ status.
25-02-06-communication1.whoToContact: Who to contact for pay system support

25-02-04-communication1.title: Department access schedule for 2024 tax slips
25-02-04-communication1.whatYouNeedToKnow:
• Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) will begin issuing the 2024 tax slips to employees on February 21, 2025.
  • 2024 tax slips in Phoenix Self Service, MyGCPay and MyGCPay external will be available to employees according to the department access schedule (refer to the Resources section below).
  • Employees using online access to retrieve their 2024 tax slips should only do so as of the date scheduled for their department or agency. The staggered approach by department ensures an efficient roll-out of tax slips and reduces the potential congestion on the systems due to the high volume of users.
  • Employees registered with Canada Revenue Agency’s or Revenu Québec’s online services will be able to access their 2024 tax information through “MyAccount” by March 3, 2025.
25-02-04-communication1.actionRequired: Departments and agencies are encouraged to review the department access schedule for 2024 tax slips and communicate the access date to their employees.
25-02-04-communication1.notes: Former employees or employees without access to the Government of Canada network can access their 2024 tax slips on MyGCPay external. Employees that have not registered for an account will have their tax slips mailed by February 28, 2025.
25-02-04-communication1.resources:
• For information on how and when to access 2024 tax slips, visit:
    • Accessing and managing your tax slips
    • Department access schedule for 2024 tax slips
  • For additional resources to help navigate tax season, refer to the Tax season toolbox.
  • Refer to the How public service pay works page for general information about pay and tax slips and to learn more about how to compare year-to-date amounts on a pay stub with tax slips.
25-02-04-communication1.whoToContact: Who to contact for pay system support

25-09-20-communication1.title: Pay System Learning Portal self-paced courses launching on September 26, 2022
25-09-20-communication1.whatYouNeedToKnow:
• Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) would like to inform compensation advisors (CAs) and pay system users that we now have new self-paced courses in the Pay System Learning Portal.
  • There are two new self-paced courses available: View Access Role and Triggers courses. Each of these courses requires that the participant take a quiz with a mandatory passing grade of 80%. Once the passing grade is obtained, a certificate of completion will be provided.
25-09-20-communication1.actionRequired:
• As per the communication sent on September 6, 2022, on initial login, users with an existing GCintranet pay system training account should select “Forgot password?” and enter their existing GCintranet account user name to retrieve the password. Users should not enter their email address.
  • Users without an existing GCintranet pay system training account will need to create one by selecting “Sign up” directly on the new platform, and by completing the form and submitting it. The training team will then create an account and send an email to the user within 72 hours.
25-09-20-communication1.resources:
• Consult the GCintranet Pay System Training page for more details on the new Pay System Learning Portal.
  • Consult the User Guide in PDF for instructions
25-09-20-communication1.whoToContact: Who to contact for pay system support

25-01-13-communication1.title: MyGCPay External available for all users
25-01-13-communication1.whatYouNeedToKnow:
• Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) will launch MyGCPay External Access for all Government of Canada employees on January 20, 2025.
  • MyGCPay External will allow current and former federal government employees to securely access their pay and benefits from outside of the Government of Canada network. Departments serviced by MyGCHR will also have external access to their human resource information.

  • Refer to the Benefit Letter Templates page for more information to help support employees.
